name: Mohammad Rahman
bio: Chef John is an expert in Bangladeshi cuisine with a passion for using fresh, locally-sourced ingredients.

recipes.ingredients: Hilsa fish, Mustard oil, Mustard paste, Green chilli, Turmeric, Ginger, Garlic, Bay leaves, Cardamom, salt
recipes.cookingMethod: Marinate fish with salt and turmeric powder. Fry the fish in mustard oil until lightly browned. In a separate pan, heat mustard oil and add mustard paste and green chili. Add water and simmer until the sauce thickens. Add fried fish to the sauce and cook for a few minutes. Serve hot with steamed rice. Serve hot with hot rice or Pilaw.

recipes.ingredients: Chicken, Yogurt, Ghee, Onion, Ginger, Garlic, Cardamom, Cinnamon, Cloves, Bay leaves, Chilli powder, Salt
recipes.cookingMethod: Marinate chicken with yogurt, chilli powder, and salt for at least an hour. Heat ghee in a pan and fry onion until golden brown. Add ginger and garlic paste and cook until fragrant. Add marinated chicken and cook until the chicken is tender. Add cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, and bay leaves and cook for a few more minutes. Serve hot with naan or paratha.

recipes.ingredients: Beef, Onion, Garlic, Ginger, Tomatoes, Green chilli, Turmeric, Chilli powder, Cumin powder, Coriander powder, Salt
recipes.cookingMethod: Heat oil in a pan and fry sliced onions until golden brown. Add garlic and ginger paste and fry until fragrant. Add diced tomatoes, green chilli, turmeric, chilli powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and mushy. Add beef and cook on medium heat until the beef is tender and the sauce has thickened. Serve hot with rice or naan.
